mal:area.comment: This section details the Platform services; the structures used by the service are detailed in section 4. The area and structures are defined in terms of the MO Message Abstraction Layer (MAL), so it is possible to deploy them over any supported protocol and message transport.
mal:area.name: Platform

mal:service.comment: The Camera service provides a generic interface to acquire pictures and control a standard camera from a Platform. The service is responsible for providing pictures to the consumer. The consumer can select the desired format in which the pictures shall be returned.
mal:service.name: Camera
mal:service.mal:documentation:
The Camera service shall provide:
  1. the capability for streaming pictures;
  2. the capability for previewing pictures;
  3. the capability for taking pictures;
  4. the capability for requesting the service and camera properties.

mal:pubsubIP.comment: The streamPictures operation allows a consumer to subscribe for picture updates.
mal:pubsubIP.name: streamPictures

mal:field.comment: The picture in streaming mode. The MAL EntityKey.firstSubKey shall be the value provided by the consumer during the setStreaming operation. The MAL EntityKey.secondSubKey shall hold a unique object instance identifier. The MAL EntityKey.thirdSubKey shall hold the width value of the resolution object provided by the consumer during the setStreaming operation. The MAL EntityKey.fourthSubKey shall hold the height value of the resolution object provided by the consumer during the setStreaming operation. The timestamp of the update shall be the time of when the picture was taken.
mal:field.name: picture

mal:submitIP.comment: The setStreaming operation allows a consumer to set the rate, dimension and format of the Pictures being streamed.
mal:submitIP.name: setStreaming

mal:field.comment: The streamingRate field shall hold the streaming rate of the pictures.
mal:field.name: streamingRate

mal:field.comment: The resolution field shall hold the desired streaming pictures resolution.
mal:field.name: resolution

mal:field.comment: The format field shall hold the desired streaming picture format.
mal:field.name: format

mal:field.comment: The firstEntityKey field holds the first entity key that will be present during the broadcast of the streamPictures operation. The firstEntityKey field must not empty, nor be NULL nor the wildcard '*'. An INVALID error shall be returned in this case.
mal:field.name: firstEntityKey

mal:errorRef.comment: The requested streaming rate is not supported.

mal:extraInformation.comment: The extra information fied shall hold the minimum duration that can be selected.

mal:errorRef.comment: The requested resolution is not supported.

mal:extraInformation.comment: The extra information fied shall hold the list of available resolutions.

mal:errorRef.comment: The requested format is not supported.

mal:extraInformation.comment: The extra information fied shall hold the list of available formats.

mal:errorRef.comment: The firstEntityKey field cannot be a null nor a wildcard.
The Camera is currently being used. Use the unsetStreaming operation in order to manually unset the streaming and try again.

mal:requestIP.comment: The previewPicture operation allows a consumer to quickly get a raw picture from the camera with a lower quality. This operation intendes to provide a quick snap of what the camera is observing.
mal:requestIP.name: previewPicture

mal:field.comment: The picture field shall hold the picture preview.
mal:field.name: picture

mal:errorRef.comment: The Camera is currently being used. Use the unsetStreaming operation in order to manually unset the streaming and try again.

mal:invokeIP.comment: The takePicture operation allows a consumer to take a picture from the camera. The appropriate dimension and format of the picture can be selected.
mal:invokeIP.name: takePicture

mal:field.comment: The resolution field shall hold the desired picture resolution.
mal:field.name: resolution

mal:field.comment: The format field shall hold the desired streaming picture format.
mal:field.name: format

mal:field.comment: The exposureTime field shall hold the exposure time of the camera.
mal:field.name: exposureTime

mal:field.comment: The picture field shall hold the picture.
mal:field.name: picture

mal:errorRef.comment: The Camera is currently being used. Use the unsetStreaming operation in order to manually unset the streaming and try again.
The requested resolution is not supported.

mal:extraInformation.comment: The extra information fied shall hold the list of available resolutions.

mal:errorRef.comment: The requested format is not supported.

mal:extraInformation.comment: The extra information fied shall hold the list of available formats.

mal:requestIP.comment: The getProperties operation allows a consumer to request the properties of the service and camera. The service shall provide information about the available resolutions, formats and some extra information.
mal:requestIP.name: getProperties

mal:field.comment: The availableResolutions field shall hold the list of the available resolutions by the camera.
mal:field.name: availableResolutions

mal:field.comment: The availableFormats field shall hold a list of available formats by the service.
mal:field.name: availableFormats

mal:field.comment: The info field shall hold additional properties of the camera. The actual content is undefined.
mal:field.name: extraInfo

mal:composite.comment: The Picture structure holds the details of the picture.
mal:composite.name: Picture

mal:field.comment: The content of the picture.
mal:field.name: content

mal:field.comment: The time of creation.
mal:field.name: creationDate

mal:field.comment: The dimension of the picture.
mal:field.name: dimension

mal:field.comment: The bit depth or color depth of the picture.
mal:field.name: bitDepth

mal:field.comment: The format of the picture.
mal:field.name: format

mal:composite.comment: The PixelResolution structure holds the pixel resolution of a picture.
mal:composite.name: PixelResolution

mal:field.comment: The width of the picture.
mal:field.name: width

mal:field.comment: The height of the picture.
mal:field.name: height

mal:field.comment: Determines if the aspect ratio of the picture must be kept. If true, the picture will keep the default aspect ratio and fit inside the maximum width or height and ignore one of the dimensions in order to avoid losing part of the picture. No cropping shall be done.
mal:field.name: keepAspectRatio

mal:enumeration.comment: PictureFormat is an enumeration definition holding the format of the picture.
mal:enumeration.name: PictureFormat

mal:service.comment: The GPS service provides an interface to receive a geographical location provided by a navigation device receiver in a Platform.
mal:service.name: GPS
mal:service.mal:documentation:
The GPS service shall provide:
  1. the capability for streaming GPS NMEA messages;
  2. the capability for enabling/disabling the streaming of NMEA messages;
  3. the capability for having getting the last known position from the GPS;
  4. the capability for getting the satellites GPS information;
  5. The capability for maintaining the list of nearby position events.

mal:invokeIP.comment: The getNMEASentence operation allows a consumer to request a NMEA sentence from a sentence identifier.
mal:invokeIP.name: getNMEASentence

mal:field.comment: The sentenceIdentifier field shall hold the sentence identifier of the request.
mal:field.name: sentenceIdentifier

mal:field.comment: The sentence field shall hold the NMEA sentence.
mal:field.name: sentence

mal:errorRef.comment: The requested sentence identifier is invalid.
The GPS unit is not available.

mal:requestIP.comment: The getLastKnownPosition operation allows a consumer to retrieve the last known position that was provided by the GPS unit.
mal:requestIP.name: getLastKnownPosition

mal:field.comment: The position field shall hold the last known position.
mal:field.name: position

mal:field.comment: The elapsedTime field shall hold the elapsed time since the position's determination.
mal:field.name: elapsedTime

mal:invokeIP.comment: The getPosition operation allows a consumer to obtain a position from the GPS unit.
mal:invokeIP.name: getPosition

mal:field.comment: The position field shall hold the current position.
mal:field.name: position

mal:errorRef.comment: The GPS unit is not available.

mal:invokeIP.comment: The getSatellitesInfo operation allows a consumer to obtain the satellites information from the GPS.
mal:invokeIP.name: getSatellitesInfo

mal:field.comment: The gpsSatellitesInfo field shall hold the information of the satellites.
mal:field.name: gpsSatellitesInfo

mal:errorRef.comment: The GPS unit is not available.

mal:requestIP.comment: The listNearbyPositionEvent operation allows a consumer to request the object instance identifiers of the existing nearby position events in the service. The operation is expected to be used in conjunction with the COM archive which holds the actual nearby position objects.
mal:requestIP.name: listNearbyPosition

mal:field.comment: The names field shall hold a list of NearbyPositionEvent names.
mal:field.name: names

mal:field.comment: The objInstIds field shall hold a list of the corresponding object instance identifiers for the selected names. The request may contain the wildcard value of '*' to return all supported nearby position events. The returned list shall maintain the same order as the submitted list unless the wildcard value was included in the request.
mal:field.name: objInstIds

mal:requestIP.comment: The addNearbyPositionEvent operation allows a consumer to define a list of nearby position events in the service.The new NearbyPosition objects are expected to be stored in the COM Archive by the provider of the GPS service.
mal:requestIP.name: addNearbyPosition

mal:field.comment: The nearbyPosition field shall hold the definition of a position.
mal:field.name: nearbyPositionDefinitions

mal:field.comment: The objInstIds field shall hold a list of the corresponding object instance identifiers for the selected names.
mal:field.name: objInstIds

mal:errorRef.comment: One of the supplied attitudeDefinitions objects contains an invalid name.

mal:extraInformation.comment: The extra information field contains a list of the indexes of the erroneous values from the originating list supplied.

mal:errorRef.comment: One or more of the nearbyPosition objects being added has a name that is already in use in the domain.

mal:extraInformation.comment: The extra information field contains a list of the indexes of the erroneous values from the originating list supplied.

mal:submitIP.comment: The removeNearbyPositionEvent operation allows a consumer to remove a list of nearby position events set in the service.
mal:submitIP.name: removeNearbyPosition

mal:field.comment: The objInstIds field shall hold a list of the corresponding object instance identifiers of the NearbyPosition objects.
mal:field.name: objInstIds

mal:errorRef.comment: One of the supplied NearbyPosition object instance identifiers is unknown.

mal:extraInformation.comment: A list of the indexes of the error values shall be contained in the extra information field.

mal:pubsubIP.comment: The nearbyPosition allows a consumer to subscribe to nearby position notifications. The notifications shall be generated upon entering or exiting a nearby position.
mal:pubsubIP.name: nearbyPosition

mal:field.comment: The isEntering field shall hold the entering state of the current position. If the GPS current position has entered the nearby position, then the field shall be set to TRUE otherwise FALSE. The MAL EntityKey.firstSubKey shall contain the NearbyPosition name. The MAL EntityKey.secondSubKey shall contain the NearbyPosition object instance identifier. The MAL EntityKey.thirdSubKey shall contain the NearbyPositionAlert object instance identifier. The MAL EntityKey.fourthSubKey shall be NULL. The timestamp of the update shall be on-board clock at the time of the notification. The ObjectId shall be set to NULL.
mal:field.name: isEntering

mal:composite.comment: The Position structure holds the position of the spacecraft given by the GPS unit.
mal:composite.name: Position

mal:field.comment: The latitude of the position. The unit is in decimal degrees.
mal:field.name: latitude

mal:field.comment: The longitude of the position. The unit is in decimal degrees.
mal:field.name: longitude

mal:field.comment: Altitude in meters according to the WGS-84 ellipsoid
mal:field.name: altitude

mal:field.comment: Extra details about the position.
mal:field.name: extraDetails

mal:composite.comment: The SatelliteInfo structure holds the information about the satellites obtained from the GPS unit.
mal:composite.name: SatelliteInfo

mal:field.comment: The azimuth of the satellite.
mal:field.name: azimuth

mal:field.comment: The elevation of the satellite.
mal:field.name: elevation

mal:field.comment: The pseudorandom noise number.
mal:field.name: prn

mal:field.comment: The almanac of the satellite.
mal:field.name: almanac

mal:field.comment: The ephemeris of the satellite.
mal:field.name: ephemeris

mal:field.comment: The time of the fix.
mal:field.name: recentFix

mal:field.comment: Space vehicle number.
mal:field.name: svn

mal:composite.comment: The PositionExtraDetails structure holds extra information that can be provided by a GPS unit.
mal:composite.name: PositionExtraDetails

mal:field.comment: UTC time status of position.
mal:field.name: utc
fixQuality

mal:field.comment: The number of satellites in view for this position.
mal:field.name: numberOfSatellites

mal:field.comment: Horizontal Dilution of Precision. The relative accuracy of horizontal position.
mal:field.name: hdop

mal:field.comment: The relationship between the geoid and the WGS84 ellipsoid. The unit is meters.
mal:field.name: undulation

mal:composite.comment: The NearbyPositionDefinition structure holds a definition of a certain Position.
mal:composite.name: NearbyPositionDefinition

mal:field.comment: The name of the definition.
mal:field.name: name

mal:field.comment: A textual description of the definition.
mal:field.name: description

mal:field.comment: The distance boundary of this definition. The distance boundary shall define a spherical zone around the position. The unit is meters.
mal:field.name: distanceBoundary

mal:field.comment: The position of the definition.
mal:field.name: position

com:object.comment: The positions markers for the events shall be represented as NearbyPosition COM objects.
com:object.name: NearbyPosition

com:sourceObject.comment: The source link of the NearbyPosition object should be the object that caused it to be created, most likely a COM OperationActivity object or an operator login in the case of off-line editors being used.

com:object.comment: The body shall contain a boolean value
com:object.name: NearbyPositionAlert

com:archiveUsage.comment: NearbyPosition objects should be stored in the COM archive. When a nearby event is published, the NearbyPosition object should be stored in the COM archive by the publisher.

mal:service.comment: The ADCS service provides an interface to control a standard ADCS device.
mal:service.name: AutonomousADCS
mal:service.mal:documentation:
The Autonomous ADCS service shall provide:
  1. the capability for periodic monitoring of the spacecraft's attitude;
  2. the capability for setting and unsetting the spacecraft's desired attitude;
  3. the capability for maintaining the list of attitude definitions;
  4. the capability for listing the object instance identifiers for the attitude definitions.

mal:pubsubIP.comment: The monitorAttitude operation allows a consumer to subscribe for the satellite's current attitude. The pointingTo field shall contain the attitude instance in a reference frame. The MAL EntityKey.firstSubKey shall contain the AttitudeDefinition name. The MAL EntityKey.secondSubKey shall contain the AttitudeDefinition object instance identifier. The MAL EntityKey.thirdSubKey shall contain the numeric value of the AttitudeMode of the AttitudeDefinition. The MAL EntityKey.fourthSubKey shall be NULL. The timestamp of the update shall be on-board clock at the time of the sampling. The ObjectId shall be set to NULL.
mal:pubsubIP.name: monitorAttitude

mal:field.comment: The attitudeInstance filed shall hold the instance of the current attitude.
mal:field.name: attitudeInstance

mal:submitIP.comment: The configureMonitoring operation allows a consumer to configure the monitoring of the satellite's current attitude.
mal:submitIP.name: configureMonitoring

mal:field.comment: The streamingRate field shall contain the publishing frequency.
mal:field.name: streamingRate

mal:errorRef.comment: The streamingRate is out of limits.

mal:submitIP.comment: The setDesiredAttitude operation allows a consumer to set the spacecraft's attitude from an attitude definition.
mal:submitIP.name: setDesiredAttitude

mal:field.comment: The object instance identifier of the attitude definition to be set.
mal:field.name: objInstId

mal:field.comment: The autoUnset field holds the duration after which the attitude definition shall be automatically unset. If the field is null, then the attitude definition won't be automatically unset, in this case the manual unsetAttitude operation must be used to disengage it.
mal:field.name: autoUnset

mal:errorRef.comment: The ADCS unit is not available.
The submited object instance identifier is unknown.
The selected attitude definition contains an invalid argument.

mal:extraInformation.comment: Contains the field name of the first field that did not pass the validation checks of the attitude definition.

mal:errorRef.comment: The ADCS is currently being used.

mal:extraInformation.comment: The service will unset the current selected attitude definition in the duration provided in the extra information field. If the extra information field is set to null, then the attitude definition shall not be automatically unset. The consumer should use the unsetAttitude operation to manually disengage it.

mal:errorRef.comment: The selected attitude definition is unsupported by the current implementation of the service.

mal:submitIP.comment: The unsetAttitude operation allows a consumer to unset the spacecraft's attitude from the current selected attitude definition. This operation is expected to be used after a certain attitude definition is set by the setDesiredAttitude operation. If the attitude was set with the automatic unsetting enabled, then the unsetAttitude operation will override it and the attitude will be unset immediately.
mal:submitIP.name: unsetAttitude

mal:errorRef.comment: The ADCS unit is not available.

mal:requestIP.comment: The listAttitudeDefinition operation allows a consumer to request the object instance identifiers of the attitude definition objects for the supported parameters of the provider. The operation is expected to be used in conjunction with the COM archive which holds the actual ParameterDefinition objects.
mal:requestIP.name: listAttitudeDefinition

mal:field.comment: The names of the Attitude definitions to be listed. The names field may contain the wildcard value of '*' to return all supported ParameterDefinition objects.
mal:field.name: names

mal:field.comment: The objIds field holds the object instance identifiers of the Attitude definitions. The returned list shall maintain the same order as the submitted list unless the wildcard value was included in the request.
mal:field.name: objIds

mal:errorRef.comment: One of the supplied AttitudeDefinition object instance identifiers is unknown.

mal:extraInformation.comment: A list of the indexes of the error values shall be contained in the extra information field.

mal:requestIP.comment: The addAttitudeDefinition operation allows a consumer to define one or more attitude definitions that do not currently exist. The new AttitudeDefinition object is expected to be stored in the COM archive by the provider of the AutonomousADCS service.
mal:requestIP.name: addAttitudeDefinition

mal:field.comment: The attitudeDefinitions field holds the attitude definitions. The name field of the supplied AttitudeDefinition structures must not be NULL, the wildcard '*', or empty. An INVALID error shall be returned in this case. The supplied name must be unique among all AttitudeDefinition objects for the domain of the provider otherwise a DUPLICATE error shall be returned. If an error is returned then no new attitude definitions shall be added as a result of this operation call.
mal:field.name: attitudeDefinitions

mal:field.comment: The objIds field holds the object instance identifiers of the attitude definitions. The returned list shall maintain the same order as the submitted definitions.
mal:field.name: objIds

mal:errorRef.comment: One of the supplied attitudeDefinitions objects contains an invalid name.

mal:extraInformation.comment: The extra information field contains a list of the indexes of the erroneous values from the originating list supplied.

mal:errorRef.comment: One or more of the attitudeDefinitions objects being added has supplied a parameter name that is already in use in the domain.

mal:extraInformation.comment: The extra information field contains a list of the indexes of the erroneous values from the originating request list.

mal:errorRef.comment: The selected attitude definition contains an invalid argument.

mal:extraInformation.comment: Contains the field name of the first field that did not pass the validation checks of the attitude definition.

mal:submitIP.comment: The removeAttitudeDefinition operation allows a consumer to remove one or more attitude definitions from the list of attitudes supported by the service. The operation does not remove the attitude definitions object from the COM archive, merely removes the object from the provider.
mal:submitIP.name: removeAttitudeDefinition

mal:field.comment: The object instance identifiers of the attitude definition to be removed. The list may contain the wildcard value of '0'. If a provided ParameterDefinition object instance identifier does not include a wildcard and does not match an existing definition then this operation shall fail with an UNKNOWN error. Matched attitude definition objects shall not be removed from the COM archive only from the list of attitude definitions objects in the provider. If an error is raised then no definitions shall be removed as a result of this operation call. If the operation succeeds then the provider shall no longer be able to set the removed attitude definitions.
mal:field.name: objIds

mal:errorRef.comment: One of the supplied AttitudeDefinition object instance identifiers is unknown.

mal:extraInformation.comment: A list of the indexes of the error values shall be contained in the extra information field.

mal:enumeration.comment: AttitudeMode is an enumeration definition holding the attitude modes.
mal:enumeration.name: AttitudeMode

mal:item.comment: B dot mode. Can also be used for detumbling and momentum unloading.

mal:enumeration.comment: ReferenceFrame is an enumeration definition holding the frames of reference.
mal:enumeration.name: ReferenceFrame

mal:field.comment: The quaternions of the current attitude instance.
mal:field.name: currentQuaternions

mal:field.comment: The quaternions of the target attitude instance.
mal:field.name: targetQuaternions

mal:field.comment: The wheels speed instance.
mal:field.name: wheelSpeed

mal:field.comment: WGS84 reference.
mal:field.name: positionVector

mal:field.comment: The angular velocity in rpm.
mal:field.name: angularVelocity

mal:field.comment: The quaternions of the current attitude instance.
mal:field.name: currentQuaternions

mal:field.comment: The quaternions of the target attitude instance.
mal:field.name: targetQuaternions

mal:field.comment: The wheels speed instance.
mal:field.name: speed

mal:field.comment: The angular velocity in rpm.
mal:field.name: angularVelocity

mal:field.comment: The axis defined in the body reference frame for spinning.
mal:field.name: bodyAxis

mal:field.comment: The magnitude of the angular velocity of the spinning in rpm. The right-hand rule shall be followed to indicate the positive direction of the angular velocity.
mal:field.name: angularVelocity

mal:field.comment: The latitude of the target to be tracked. The unit is in decimal degrees.
mal:field.name: latitude

mal:field.comment: The longitude of the target to be tracked. The unit is in decimal degrees.
mal:field.name: longitude

com:objects.comment: An AttitudeDefinitionBDot COM object represents the definition of a BDot attitude. The object body shall hold an AttitudeDefinitionBDot structure. The AttitudeDefinitionBDot COM object source link should be the object that caused it to be created, most likely a COM OperationActivity object. An AttitudeDefinitionSingleSpinning COM object represents the definition of a Single Spinning attitude. The object body shall hold an AttitudeDefinitionSingleSpinning structure. The AttitudeDefinitionSingleSpinning COM object source link should be the object that caused it to be created, most likely a COM OperationActivity object. An AttitudeDefinitionSunPointing COM object represents the definition of a Sun Pointing attitude. The object body shall hold an AttitudeDefinitionSunPointing structure. The AttitudeDefinitionSunPointing COM object source link should be the object that caused it to be created, most likely a COM OperationActivity object. An AttitudeDefinitionTargetTracking COM object represents the definition of a Target Tracking attitude. The object body shall hold an AttitudeDefinitionTargetTracking structure. The AttitudeDefinitionTargetTracking COM object source link should be the object that caused it to be created, most likely a COM OperationActivity object. An AttitudeDefinitionNadirPointing COM object represents the definition of a Nadir Pointing attitude. The object body shall hold an AttitudeDefinitionNadirPointing structure. The AttitudeDefinitionNadirPointing COM object source link should be the object that caused it to be created, most likely a COM OperationActivity object.

com:events.comment: An ADCSProblemDetected COM event represents the detection of a problem on the ADCS. The object body can hold a blob of data containing implementation-specific data. The ADCSProblemDetected COM event shall be generated upon the detection of a problem with the ADCS.

com:archiveUsage.comment: AttitudeDefinitionBDot COM objects should be stored in the COM archive. AttitudeDefinitionSingleSpinning COM objects should be stored in the COM archive. AttitudeDefinitionSunPointing COM objects should be stored in the COM archive. AttitudeDefinitionTargetTracking COM objects should be stored in the COM archive. AttitudeDefinitionNadirPointing COM objects should be stored in the COM archive.

mal:service.comment: The Software-defined Radio provides an generic interface to set, configure and receive data from a Software-defined Radio device.
mal:service.name: SoftwareDefinedRadio

mal:pubsubIP.comment: The streamRadio operation allows a consumer to subscribe for Software-defined Radio data updates.
mal:pubsubIP.name: streamRadio

mal:field.comment: The iqComponents field shall hold the in-phase and quadrature data from the Software-defined Radio unit.
mal:field.name: iqComponents

mal:submitIP.comment: The enableSDR operation allows a consumer to enable or disable the Software-defined Radio.
mal:submitIP.name: enableSDR

mal:field.comment: The enable field shall hold the flag status to enable/disable the Software-defined Radio. If the enable field is true then the Software-defined Radio shall be enabled otherwise disabled.
mal:field.name: enable

mal:field.comment: The initialConfiguration field shall hold the configuration to be set right after the SDR is enabled.
mal:field.name: initialConfiguration

mal:errorRef.comment: The provided configuration is invalid.
The Software-defined Radio could not be enabled.

mal:submitIP.comment: The setConfiguration operation allows a consumer to set a configuration to the Software-defined Radio.
mal:submitIP.name: updateConfiguration

mal:field.comment: The configuration field holds the configuration of the SDR.
mal:field.name: configuration

mal:errorRef.comment: The provided configuration is invalid.

mal:field.comment: Local Oscillator Frequency
mal:field.name: LOFrequency

mal:field.comment: Low-noise Amplifier Gain
mal:field.name: LNA

mal:field.comment: Variable Gain Amplifier 1
mal:field.name: VGA1

mal:field.comment: Variable Gain Amplifier 2
mal:field.name: VGA2

mal:field.comment: Low Pass Filter frequency in GHz
mal:field.name: LPF

mal:field.comment: The frequency in MHz
mal:field.name: sampleRate

mal:composite.comment: It holds the In-phase and Quadrature components.
mal:composite.name: IQComponents

mal:field.comment: The in-phase component.
mal:field.name: inPhase

mal:field.comment: The quadrature component.
mal:field.name: quadrature

mal:service.comment: The Optical Data Receiver service provides an interface to receive messages from an Optical Data Receiver device.
mal:service.name: OpticalDataReceiver

mal:pubsubIP.comment: The streamData operation allows a consumer to subscribe to a stream feed from the Optical Data Receiver.
mal:pubsubIP.name: streamData

mal:field.comment: The data field holds a blob of data coming from the Optical Data Receiver.
mal:field.name: data

mal:requestIP.comment: The setPublishingFrequency operation allows a consumer to set the publishing frequency or disable it.
mal:requestIP.name: setPublishingFrequency

mal:field.comment: The publishingFrequency field shall hold the frequency rate of the stream updates. If set to 0, then no updates will be generated.
mal:field.name: publishingFrequency

mal:service.comment: The Generic Device service provides a generic interface to interact with any possible device. The service achieves this by providing two simple operations, one to receive data and other to send data.
mal:service.name: GenericDevice

mal:pubsubIP.comment: The receiveData operation alows a consumer to subscribe to messages from a Generic Device. The origin and content of the data is implementation-specific.
mal:pubsubIP.name: receiveData

mal:field.comment: The message field holds the data coming from the generic device.
mal:field.name: message

mal:submitIP.comment: The sendData operation allows a consumer to send data to a generic device.
mal:submitIP.name: sendData

mal:field.comment: The message field shall hold the content to be sent.
mal:field.name: message

mal:requestIP.comment: The getMagneticField operation allows a consumer to retrieve the magnetic field instance from a magnetometer unit.
mal:requestIP.name: getMagneticField

mal:field.comment: The magneticField field shall hold the magnetic field instance of the magnetometer.
mal:field.name: magneticField

mal:composite.comment: An instance of the magnetic field vector
mal:composite.name: MagneticFieldInstance

mal:field.comment: The X component of the magetic field in microTesla.
mal:field.name: x

mal:field.comment: The Y component of the magetic field in microTesla.
mal:field.name: y

mal:field.comment: The Z component of the magetic field in microTesla.
mal:field.name: z

mal:field.comment: The x component of the Vector. The unit shall be defined by each specific case.
mal:field.name: x

mal:field.comment: The y component of the Vector. The unit shall be defined by each specific case.
mal:field.name: y

mal:field.comment: The z component of the Vector. The unit shall be defined by each specific case.
mal:field.name: z

mal:composite.comment: The WheelSpeed holds the speed of the wheels.
mal:composite.name: WheelSpeed

mal:field.comment: Velocity of the wheels. <Units must be defined here>
mal:field.name: velocity

mal:field.comment: Quaternion component 1. Equivalent to the i component.
mal:field.name: q1

mal:field.comment: Quaternion component 2. Equivalent to the j component.
mal:field.name: q2

mal:field.comment: Quaternion component 3. Equivalent to the k component.
mal:field.name: q3

mal:field.comment: Quaternion component 4. Equivalent to the l component.
mal:field.name: q4

mal:error.comment: The device is currently in use.
mal:error.name: DEVICE_IN_USE

mal:error.comment: The device is currently not available.
mal:error.name: DEVICE_NOT_AVAILABLE
